This is a difficult one. We can still pass `BundleComponentProps` into the root component, however the internally mapped components (in the `modules` property) doesn't map in the props from the dynamically-imported component. So in the `render` property we can do: ```tsx { render: (props, { Hello1, Hello2 }) => (

{props.foo}

) } ``` but we can't use the props from `asyncComponent` since it's mapped as `React.ComponentType<{}>` ```tsx { render: (props, { Hello1, Hello2 }) => (

{props.foo}

// error
) } ```
That being said, the scope of this PR was only to fix the dynamic imports type error. I can try and solve this on a separate PR after this is merged.
Yeah, I see the problem. But the modules map is dynamically generated.. not sure if that's possible at all, unless with some TS wizardry ðŸ˜©
